text: ке джабі ке джабі бга̄і бгава-сіндгу па̄ра
translation: Who will go, oh brother, who will go to cross the ocean of material existence? The wealth and great fortune of this age of Kali is the incarnation of Lord Chaitanya.

text: кадіпа̄ті на̄хі ла̄ґе амані па̄ра хой
translation: My Lord Gaurāṅga stands at the jetty ready to ferry his servants upstream across this material existence. For no charge he is immediately taking them.
The ferry-boat is the Holy Names of the Lord and the spiritual master is the captain. The oars are the outstretched arms in the saṅkīrtan.
The favourable wind is divine love for Lord Krishna and all the fallen souls have been rescued on this boat. Only Lochan Dās is left behind due to the faults of his own misdeeds.
